oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of Rachel Jackson's homeplace, the Battle of Rock Island historical marker, a man reading a large bible, a portrait of the city supervisor of buildings, construction of the first street car track, and three ads. Tennessean, 1931 January 4.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Rachel; Caldwell, Mary French; Moore, Mrs. John Trotwood; Waynai, L.; Moore, Robert T.; Wain, Mary Ruth
Nashville Tennessean
Cabins; Fireplaces; Historical markers; Portraits; Cityscapes; Construction
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of Rachel Jackson's homeplace, the Battle of Rock Island historical marker, a man reading a large bible, a portrait of the city supervisor of buildings, 1889 construction of the first street car track on Fourth Avenue, and three ads, one of which features a local child. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
